intro: Miconia macuxi, commonly known as the "Brazilian star," is a shrub or small tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by distinctive purple or red berries. It thrives in humid, tropical environments with high rainfall and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
